thread.title: 3 things to do in Wickenburg

author: azcentral.com
title: 3 things to do in Wickenburg
text:
If you’re looking for a way to enjoy yourself during the long Labor Day weekend but don’t feel like a full-on road trip, consider a day drive to Wickenburg. You can pick apples, hear mariachi music and learn about the city’s pioneer history. While you’re there, treat yourself to some ice cream.
Eat
Indulge your sweet tooth at Chaparral Homemade Ice Cream, where the Hassayampa Mud is a rich blend of homemade chocolate and coffee ice creams. Other frozen flavors include coconut cream, pistachio and cappuccino. Don’t miss the the Arizona-inspired prickly-pear ice cream. The menu also includes salads, sandwiches, pizzas and burritos. Breakfast is served all day.
Details: 472 E. Wickenburg Way. 928-684-3252, www.chaparral-icecream.com .
Play
At the Fiesta de Septiembre, celebrate Wickenburg’s Hispanic pioneer heritage while learning about early families through stories and photographs. Live entertainment includes mariachi music and folklorico dancers. Amenities include an outdoor mercado, food and beverage booths and a kids zone.
Details: 11 a.m.-6 p.m. Saturday, Sept. 5. Wickenburg Community Center, 160 N. Valentine St. $5, free for age 18 and younger. 928-684-5479, wickenburgchamber.com .
Take a crisp bite into fall at the Apple Festival at Date Creek Ranch. The free event includes apple picking and the opportunity to buy apple pies, apple butter and other goods in support of Morristown School. Orders for grass-fed beef, lamb and pork can also be placed during the event.
Details: 7 a.m.-3 p.m. Saturday-Sunday, Sept. 5-6. Date Creek Ranch, 22 miles northwest of Wickenburg on U.S. 93. Free admission; $1.25 per pound for apples. 928-231-0704, datecreekranch.com .
